beans.description:
This adaptor does the following... Receives input from the Console (stdin) Passes it through a script processor called ChangePayload to: 1) Cache the original payload in the metadata with a key of origPayload 2) Append text to the payload 3) Cause three windows to pop up in sequence a) Show the payload (oa_data) b) Show the metadata (oa_metadata) 3) Show the original payload via the key origPayload Passes it through a script processor called CauseException to: 1) Cause an exception Catches exception Passes it through a script processor called CopyCached_oa_data to: 1) Copy cached oa_data to replace oa_data (which contains oa_data as it was at start of failing component) which is in MessageException Converts MessageException to ordered map as new oa_data Uses script to show pop-up to see the oa_data Writes original input plus appended text to the Console (stdout) Alternative write to OA_Hospital beans are also there but commented out for this example
Run adaptor like this:
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config exception-005.xml
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar

property.name: script
script
property.value: oa_data = new org.openadaptor.core.exception.MessageException(oa_data.getMetadata().get("origPayload"), oa_metadata, oa_data.getException(), oa_data.getOriginatingModule(), oa_data.getOriginatingThreadName());
